newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rate pares rise on trade balance data.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rate pares rise on trade balance data.

text.p: Mexican overnight Cetes rates checked an initial advance to stand up 75 basis points at 18.75 percent in early trade on Thursday, following strong trade balance figures, dealers said.
"We expected upside pressure on rates, but trade balance figures are helping the market a lot," a trader said.
Dealers said overnight Cetes rates had opened up 19.25 percent under pressure from a weak peso.
Mexico's Finance Ministry announced in early trade in had revised trade surplus data for March up to $636 million from a preliminary figure of $565 million.
Benchmark 48-hour peso contracts opened 2.1 centavos weaker at 7.9450/7.9500 per dollar, but had since firmed to 7.9220/7.9250.
Overnight rates on bank paper mirrored the trend in government rates by receding to 20.00 percent, or 10 percent up on Wednesday's close, from 20.15 percent at the open.
Dealers said secondary interest rates had also moderated initial advances due to a recovery by U.S. long bonds.
The U.S. 30-year Treasury bond was up 10/32 to yield 6.94 percent in mid-morning trade.
Liquidity of 1.034 billion pesos was slated to return to the system from prior central bank participation.
